definition: contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: Most transitive verbs can take a reflexive pronoun.
sentences.chinese: 大部分及物動詞可接反身代詞作賓語。

sentences.english: Both informatics knowledge and natural science knowledge have reflexivity.
sentences.chinese: 情報學知識與自然科學知識都具有反身性。

sentences.english: The aim of this paper is to make a comparative study of the reflexive pronouns in Mandarin Chinese and English.
sentences.chinese: 本論文主旨在在比較漢語和英語中的反身代名詞。

sentences.english: Reflexive pronouns can be direct or indirect object.
sentences.chinese: 反身代詞可作直接或間接賓語。

sentences.english: We will also learn about reflexive pronouns.
sentences.chinese: 此外還將學習反身代詞。

sentences.english: The result of empirical test testifies existence of reflexivity mechanism of forming process of corporation value.
sentences.chinese: 實證結果證明了公司價值形成反身機制的存在性。

sentences.english: Most transitive verbs can take a reflexive pronoun as object.
sentences.chinese: 大部分及物動詞可跟反身代詞作賓語。

sentences.english: A reflexive pronoun can also be used as the indirect object of a verb.
sentences.chinese: 反身代名詞也可以用來當作一個的動詞的間接賓語。

sentences.english: Remember, the supertype relation is reflexive.
sentences.chinese: 記住超類型的關係是反身的。

sentences.english: Complete the sentences below using the appropriate reflexive pronoun.
sentences.chinese: 用合適的反身代詞填空，完成下列句子。

sentences.english: Most transitive verbs can take a reflexive pronoun as object.
sentences.chinese: 大部分及物動詞可接反身代詞作賓語。

definition: to turn a hand over/to put one's hand behind one's back/fig. easily done
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
to take advantage/to seize an opportunity/in passing/without taking extra trouble/conveniently
to take advantage of a favorable situation/to seize an opportunity
to jump up suddenly/to bound up/to rise up in one bound
to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
be high up in the sky
